meanings.definition: Relating to the study of manuscripts.
meanings.sent1: The codicological research helped the scholars understand ancient texts.
meanings.sent2: The codicological approach provided valuable insights into the handwritten documents.
meanings.sent3: The codicological experts had a field day examining the old parchments.
meanings.sent4: Her codicological skills were as sharp as a magnifying glass on paper.
meanings.sent5: The codicological details were like puzzle pieces waiting to be put together.

meanings.definition: The codicological analysis revealed the age of the document.
meanings.sent1: The codicological of the manuscript indicated it was from the Middle Ages.
meanings.sent2: His codicological of the ancient scroll was thorough and precise.
meanings.sent3: The codicological of the diary showed it was written centuries ago.
meanings.sent4: The codicological was like a time machine, revealing the past through ink and paper.
meanings.sent5: The codicological unveiled secrets hidden within the yellowed pages.

meanings.definition: The codicological evidence supported the historian's theory.
meanings.sent1: The codicological in the archives confirmed the historical account.
meanings.sent2: Her codicological was crucial in proving the authenticity of the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The codicological pointed to a different narrative than previously thought.
meanings.sent4: The codicological was a key that unlocked the mysteries of the past.
meanings.sent5: The codicological whispered stories of bygone eras to those who listened.
